intro: Cynoglossum montanum subsp. linnaeanum, commonly known as the Linnaean mouse-ear, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, oval-shaped leaves and small blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. It is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and blooms. The subspecies is distinguished by its specific morphology and geographic distribution compared to other members of the Cynoglossum genus.
